fields.description:
If you run the integrity checker and there's problems, the fixes don't cascade to all data that refers to the problems.

At least if a fix removes a SearchRequest, the fix might still leave a Portlet into the DB which refers to the request which was deleted by the fixer. The user can only see this by running the Integrity Checker multiple times.

The Checker should either fix the problems throughout or rerun itself immediately after fixing so that the user will see there's new problems introduced by the previous fix.
fields.summary: DB integrity checker's fixes can introduce new problems
JIRA DB import needs progress view page

fields.description: Currently the "add portlet" page has rather tiny images of each portlet, that don't really tell you much unless you click on them.  This could be easily solved by having the images about twice as wide, and perhaps reduced in size to fit more in.
fields.summary: Add Portlets page images should be bigger

fields.description:
The portlet names need to be returned pre-i18n'ized.

This allows custom portlet plugins to be created with i18n files for all strings (including the name). 

At present, the names are retrieved from JiraWebActionSupport.properties or Dashborad.properties.
fields.summary: Portlet names need to be returned i18n'ized.

fields.description:
When I try the build the jira 3.0 source release I get the error which appears below.

Note: I have successfully built every source release (since 2.6.1) previously made available from atlassian.com. This has been 10 or so source releases. To build each release I have downloaded the tar.gz file to my windows xp machine (though this time I have tried both the tar.gz and the zip with the same results) and unzipped the release to a directory. I change to the jira directory and modify files as detailed below before the error output). 

Then I execute the command:
maven jira:release-enterprise

Note: the same error below is returned if I only issue the command 'maven'.

Build file modifications:
goto www.atlassian.com, search for make instuctions and note them
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/building.html

unzip the file to a directory and modify the build file (jira/maven.xml) slightly
1) search for the following text: - this allows you to build the api documentation
<attainGoal name="test:mail-report"/>
and copy the following text replacing the line you searched for
<!-- <attainGoal name="test:mail-report"/> -->

2) search for the following text:
<fileset dir="${ant.location}/ant-${ant.version}"/>
and copy the following text replacing the line you searched for
<fileset dir="${ant.location}"/>

3) add the following lines to jira/build.properties
(note - I haven't figured out yet how to turn off warnings...the last two lines try to do this, but it doesn't seem to work yet):
build.compiler=jikes
ant.location=c:/apache-ant-1.6.2
build.compiler.warnings=false
nowarn=true

4) download and install apache ant to the default directory

---

contents of build.properties:
maven.repo.remote=file:../lib,http://repository.atlassian.com,http://www.ibiblio.org/maven
maven.test.skip=true
build.compiler=jikes
ant.location=c:/apache-ant-1.6.2
build.compiler.warnings=false
nowarn=true

---

fields.description:
I've written a listener basing it off a 'standard' issue event listener from Atlassian. I've attached it (after filing the bug).

The listener calls a web listener running on somewhere else. There is no problem calling the external web listener. 

The problem is that the event parameter routine 'getComment()' will return a null value if a comment is the only modification done to the issue.

I fully realize that my users could go and select 'add comment' under 'operations' while browsing the issue. However, my users are stupid and will more than likely select 'edit issue' and only add a comment.

Note: If a single field is modified in addition to adding an issue comment then the event.getComment() returns the new comment.

I've written my listener to log messages for every event call - the only event which is called after the issue is modified is 'issueUpdated'. issueCommented is not called unless the user selects 'add comment' under operations.

I can work around this by modifying the jsp file for edit issue and removing the lines which display the comment box. However, I would like to avoid this if possible.

-wc

fields.description:
It would be very cool if you entered in an issue, and Jira matched against existing issues.

If the match probability is good, then you could suggest:

"Are these issues the same? Would you like to add your report as a comment to this issue?"

"Are these issues related? Would you like to link them?"

In all cases, you could prompt the user to vote/watch the matched issues.

This would reduce the number of duplicate issues - and would enhance the quality of the information entered.

fields.description:
The page http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa includes a <Log In> link in the top-right corner. Clicking this link brings you to the page http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa?os_destination=%2Fsecure%2FDashboard.jspa, which again has a <Log In> link. Clicking this link brings you to the page http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa?os_destination=%2Fsecure%2FDashboard.jspa%3Fos_destination%3D%252Fsecure%252FDashboard.jspa. In other words: Jira produces ever longer URLs and directs the browser to a new page each time (different URLs --> different page, as far as the browser concerns).

This issue is not a problem in day-to-day use, but it is a problem for some site crawlers: these tend to get stuck in the Jira web interface as it keeps producing new pages. This creates an unnecessary burden on sites running Jira. Hope you can fix this soon.
fields.summary: Clicking the Log In link creates ever longer URLs

fields.summary: Time Tracking Report displays wrong dropdown menu

fields.description: If a license is updated, the License information window still displays the previous text. It updates only when Tomcat is rebooted.
fields.summary: License problems

fields.description: We need a Jelly tag that can create an attachment, perhaps by taking an absolute filesystem path.  This is a common need for people doing imports.
fields.summary: Jelly attachments tag

fields.description:
We have found that when entering logs that sometimes it is necessary to change the log.  Sometimes accidents are made.  We also use the Work log extensively and we do our billing to our clients based on the times that are in JIRA.  But if we get behind or are out at a client we may not get all of our time entered for a given day.  so we go back and enter our time for that day.  The way we do this currently is by putting the date at the top of the log so that we can go into SQL directly to update it.  This is a major pain.  It would be nice if we could edit a given log so we could change the date, the time or even the log text itself.  

We have some junior developers that sometimes get trigger happy and enter a work log before they have put in their comments.  It would be nice if they could go back and make the correction without us having to go into SQL directly.
fields.summary: Adjusting Worklogs and Comments

fields.description:
Let me start with a custom field that we have available on the issue level.  We have a Bill As custom field to help us when we generate invoices.  We generate all of our invoices with the data in JIRA as this contains all of our times via worklog.  So an issue may be listed as Development - Billable, Development - Non-Billable, Support - Billable, Support - Non-Billable, etc...

What we've been finding though is that for a given issue, the majority of it might be Development - Billable, but the client may call up and as a quick question or so in relation to that ticket and we may want to log 15 minutes as Project Management - Non-Billable.  That's not exactly the best example but I think it gets the point across.

It would be awesome if we could have a custom field available for the individual worklogs so we could set that per log that was entered.  That would help us from having to adjust time after we generate the report to make the report look right and from having us to create a lot of other issues that relate to the one.

What would be even better is if that custom field could default to the main selection from the issue custom field.  In other words if we have selected Development - Billable for the issue.  The worklog custom field would default to that selection but could be changed.  I'd be happy with just the first part though.
fields.summary: Work Log Custom Fields

fields.description:
it's not possible, to select multiple projects while searching for Issues. There's just "ALL Projects" or Project xyz.

It would also be nice:

- customize the shown fields in the web view (in excel all fields are shown...)
- ability to use regular expressions (and / or)
fields.summary: more complex "Find Issue"  (regular expressions / select multiple projects)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4937].
  {panel}

We are handling lots of single projects, with single project-groups, which mustn't see each others projects.

Therefore assume we want to setup a new Project named "X-Project". Then we do the following steps:
1. Create a group named "X-Project"
2. Create users
3. Click every single user into the group (boooring)
4. Create a Permission Scheme from a template Scheme through copy
4b. Rename the Scheme to "X-Project"
4c. Add the "X-Project"-group to the right permissions
5. Create a Layout-Scheme from a template Scheme through copy
5b. Rename the Scheme to "X-Project"
6. Create a Notification Scheme from a template Scheme through copy
6b. Rename the Scheme to "X-Project"
7. FINALLY! Create a Project !!! And Assign all Schemes to it !!!

OK, this was just to show you how much time and effort it takes to setup projects like this. 

THIS is, what i think would improve this SOMEWHAT:

THE ALL NEW CREATE PROJECT PAGE !
Here is what it looks like:
   - Like today: Name, Project Lead, etc.

   - For each scheme (Notification, Permission, Layout, Security) you either select an existing
     one (like today) of you select one and also activate a checkbox which reads (create from  
     template)
   - if the "create from template" checkbox is activated for a selected scheme, this scheme 
     gets copied and renamed to the name of the project after you click the Create Button
   - There is another checkbox : Create "Project Group". If this checkbox is activated a 
     group will be created, which is named exactly like the project
   - Click "Create"
   - Everything gets created
   - You are asked, which users to add to the new project group (if you created such a group) and 
     you can select them from a listbox (with multi-select) and click on add. These users are then      added to the new group
   - Done - you get navigated to the newly created project administration page

The only thing left to do would be editing the new schemes. Or has anyone good ideas how to get the scheme editing neatly into this process?
fields.summary: Super-Easy Project Setup incl. Group, Permissions, Layouts and Users

fields.description:
If you do the following steps

1. run the first step of the setup
2. close the browser.
3. run the setup again.

You get an error saying "Could not activate indexing: Cannot activate indexing as it is already active."
fields.summary: Setup fails if you run it twice

fields.description:
When i add the "Current Reporter" to the "Browse Project" Permission of one project. This project instantly becomes visible to ALL users(via the project table portlet), if they have any kind of permission to see this project or not. 

So all users can see this project, but can't see any issues within it. Thats not very good, as we want to keep our customers strictly seperated from one another and we have a lot of projects. That would be very confusing if you see lots of projects in your dashboard, but only one or two of them are relevant to you and the rest is empty.
fields.summary: "Browse Project" permission for "Current Reporter" grants users to see projects they are not permitted to.

fields.description:
I have added a custom issue type "missing feature". Issues of that type appear in the "Änderungsprotokoll" (changelog) and the "Road Map" but not in the "Release Notes". 

How can I include the new issue type into the release notes?
fields.summary: Custom Issue Types missing in Release Notes

fields.description:
I want to move an Issue from one project to another.

- In the first Screen, I choose the destination project
- In the second screen, I choose components, version and customfields

- the next step would be "confirmation" but i dont get there. I press the submit button but jira only gets to the second screen. No error message, nothing :-(

I had the problem with the beta too and thought i would be resolved for final, as there were some problems with moving.

Did a reindex, but still the same behaviour

tested on two servers ( the second is for testing jira updates before going into live-system)
fields.summary: Cant move Issues

fields.description:
Hi,

When wrong permissions are given JIRA shows another page to provide them again. However, in Mozilla 1.8a4 the page isn't displayed properly. Is JIRA so tied to IE?

Do the following to reproduce the issue (assuming Mozilla is used):

1/ Go to http://issues.apache.org/jira as anonymous
2/ "Create new issue"
3/ Choose "Login"
4/ Provide wrong credentials and press "Log in"
5/ The next page doesn't display properly (see the attachment)

Jacek
fields.summary: Broken page in Mozilla when wrong credentials provided

fields.description:
If i want a user to be restricted to post new issues only i would revoke his right to "browse projects". Only one thing is pretty ugly, when i do this. 

After the user saves the new issue he gets a BIG RED ERROR MESSAGE, telling him he has no right to use this function. The user might now think, that he has no right to save the issue he just entered, but in reality he misses the right to show his entered message, which would have been the next screen after he presses the save-button.

My idea is:
Change the navigation for users who dont have the right to browse a project to the empty dashboard, after the save button is pressed.
fields.summary: Suppress Error Message, when user has no right to browse project

fields.description:
Is there any way to customize the Issue status workflow, perhaps by adding more Issue States (statuses)?  I would like to isolate each state of Issues and assign control the permissions by means of roles (groups).
For instance, we would like the following sequences:

Submitted: From Support Team
Open: Project Manager opens issue and assigns to developer
Accepted: Developer accepts
Dev In Progress: Developer working on issue
Rejected by Developer: Developer rejects as issue
Fixed: Developer resolves
QA Ready: Issue is pending validation from QA
QA In Progress: QA working on issue
Rejected by QA: QA rejects developer's resolution
Closed As Fixed: Issue resolved and closed
Closed As Rejected: Issue closed - not valid issue

I realize that some of these states are provided, but wish to enforce a more rigid workflow.  Is there any way to customize the Issue and Statuses and/or the Permission Schemes?
fields.summary: Customizing the Issue Status Workflow

fields.description:
A few people have reported that fieldtype-db2.xml needs to be modified to specify the size of CLOBs and BLOBs, eg:

BLOB -> BLOB(1000)
CLOB -> CLOB(2000)

This modification seems to only be necessary for certain versions of DB2. We should establish what these versions are, and produce two versions of fieldtype-db2.xml if necessary.
fields.summary: Handle CLOB/BLOB limits in DB2

fields.description:
I have a custom field called ElemenTool ID of type Text which holds my original bug tracking ID (issues were imported from ElemenTool).  I created another custom field called Bundled Products of type Multiple Select.  I produced a report using a filter and did a Bulk Change on all the filtered issues.  I checked all items and chose Edit all the selected issues.  The ONLY field I checked to change was the Bundled Products field and I set it to one of the values in the select list.  The confirmation page showed the appropriate change for all the filtered issues and also showed the ElemenTool field remained unchanged (every issue had an ElemenTool ID).  After updating, these filtered issues had the desired change, but all my ElemenTool IDs were blank!

I've reproduced this twice.  It effectively makes the Bulk Change feature unusable for us.
fields.summary: Bulk Change blows away custom field values

fields.description:
In JRA-4897 Owen describes how to add an icon to a portlet. If I understand him correctly, basically you have to put some gifs somewhere in the filesystem, i.e. outside your jar file.

However, I thought the whole point about the plugin system was that plugins were self contained in a jar file, so I can install them by simply by copying the jar to WEB-INF/lib. It shouldn't be necessary to add additionall gif files to make the plugin work.

Please provide a way to place the icons inside the jar file, for example by declaring
<thumbnail location="classpath">/my/company/portlet/preview.gif</thumbnail>, to load the icon from the classpath instead of the webapp root dir.
fields.summary: Allow portlet icons to reside in plugin jar file

fields.description:
I have a problem with the datepicker. Instead of updating the date in the Slovenian locale it uses the default locale.

Explanation:

When I pick a date where the first three letters of the month in Slovenian notation  don't match with the English locale (ex. ENG: 13-Oct-2004, SLO: 13-Okt-2004), the page responses:

*********************************************************************************
You did not enter a valid date. Please enter the date in the format "d-MMM-yyyy".
Due Date: <textbox>
*********************************************************************************

Then I have to change the month, for example: Oct -> Okt

On the other side, if the first three letters of the month match in both languages,
(ex. ENG: 13-Sep-2004, SLO: 13-Sep-2004), Jira accepts it, of-course.

Do I have a wrong configuration?

fields.description: I originally turned on time tracking to look at the time tracking reporting, but didn't change the defaults of 24 hours / day, 7 days / week (and why make that the default, anyway? How about 8/5?) When I went to view the time tracking, the 24 hours of work I had logged showed up as 1 day, so I went in to change the time tracking settings. It just showed me the current settings of 24/7 but no way to change it. I looked all around through the admin pages looking for the place to change this. I even went to the Jira instance on opensymphony.com to look at the admin console there, and saw that these could be set on the time tracking page in the admin pages, since the time tracking had not been turned on. I figured out that I needed to de-activate the time tracking by clicking the "deactivate" button, then I was able to change the hours and days settings and re-activate. This is pretty confusing.

This would be useful in cases where a number of issues have already been created and the user wishes to group them as sub-tasks under one parent issue (e.g. Documentation issues for 3.0).

Anyway my problem is that I have a hard time navigating around the different functions on Jira.  It's not very intuitive.  Have you guys ever done a user task analysis or similar usability test?  You'll discover a heckuva alot.

I like alot of the features of this product ...but I just find it difficult to use.  Improving the usability would help alot!
Anoop
fields.summary: user interface is not intuitive

fields.description:
We enter all the initial estimates for issues in hours, yet JIRA displays the estimate in days and hours. For example:

If we enter 10 hours for an estimate JIRA will dislpay it as '1 day 2 hours'. The problem with this is that it gives an impression of elapsed time rather than the duration of the task/issue.  The task may take 10 hours and be completed of 5 days (2 hours per day), so it has a duration of 10 hours and a elapsed time of 5 days.

It would be good to be able to specify the format for displaying the times.  My preference would be to use hours only (10.5 hours) or hours and minutes (10 hours 30 minutes).

This applies to the time tracking report as well.
fields.summary: Ability to change the format of durations to hours only for time tracking

fields.description: Tried using the mentioned page to set a value to "Resolution" issue field.  The value came out blank whereas another field "Environment" showed the correct value I set it to.  I've attached the our workflow as per request by Jeff.  Please take a look.  This field is critical for our project here at iMany.  Thanks.
fields.summary: Update Issue Field in  "Add Post Function To Transition" page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4827].
  {panel}

As many of us use JIRA in our projects and as the startscreen is such a nice worklpce environment it would be really great if there could be the most important Due Dates/Milestones displayed e.g. in a portlet.

I want to suggest following useful addition to JIRA:
- Project Administration Page
  - add date-fields to the relaese box
  - at least two date fields are necessary : (1)start test, (2)delivery
  - these date-fields schould then be displayed in the road map and the change history

  - add a new control (like the release-control)
  - Here you can enter 'Important Project Dates' (e.g. Milestones, Meetings, ...)
  - Information to be entered per date: Name, Date (e.g. Trade Fair, 1.Oct.2004)
  - So you can create a list of dates 
  - These dates should then be displayed in a new portlet
  - The new portlet should only show the next 5 upcoming dates
  - So every teammember always knows whats coming up

What do you think?

I would guess the effort should be medium to implement this, as this is a pretty isolated addition to the system not affecting that many other components.
fields.summary: Project Due Date / Milestone Management

fields.summary: Need to switch off self-notification for all users

fields.description:
We recently upgraded from #64 to #65 and left the old directory intact just in case we needed to go back. Now I have finally had the time to clean up and when I removed the old directory I discovered that the Jira wasn't showing all the information as it had done earlier today. I quickly restored the directory and everything is working again.

So somewhere there is a reference to the "old" installation path and not the new one. The trick is however, that our installation path is /usr/local/jira where jira is a softlink to the actual jira folder. That is, we havent added ANY path to anything else but /usr/local/jira. I'm thinking that maybe the installation has written the ACTUAL path rather than the relative path - could this be ?

Anyways I just thought I should mention this as it is a bit strange...

I enclosed a png image file of our directory structure just to make sure you understand.
fields.summary: Upgrade from #64 to #65 is resulting in some minor issues...

In the LogWork page, the fields are presented, from top to bottom, as: 

Time Spent
Adjust Estimate
Work Description
Log Viewable By

Once I enter a value in "Time Spent", if I press tab until I get to the "Work Description" text field, "Adjust Estimate" will be set to "Set estimated time remaining" because I went through the text input field in my way to "Work Description".

Not a big deal, but I stumble on this many times a day !

23:27:49.983 EVENT  Started WebApplicationContext[/jira,Atlassian JIRA Web Application]

2004-10-03 23:27:51,604 ERROR [NoModule]

fields.description: Various people wish to know how to extend JIRA by overriding pico-managed components.  In early 3.0 versions this could be done by writing a custom Pico ContainerProvider, but apparently this doesn't work in 3.0 beta, and anyway the proper way to do this is by writing a plugin.  We should document how to do this.
fields.summary: Write doc on extending JIRA by overriding components

fields.description:
Currently we store two versions of most translation properties files; a *-native.txt version in the native encoding, and a *.properties equivalent, properly rendered or escaped in iso-8859-1.  We should rather store just the ASCII properties files, and convert them back to the native encoding for translators at runtime (via 'native2ascii -reverse').

This also avoids the problem where IDEA breaks files by saving them as UTF-8
fields.summary: Convert all i18n properties files to ASCII
